poem:
Title: "Snapshots of Gaza"

Gaza hangs, a ripped canvas,
as gunshots sow metal seeds in tender flesh,
sermons of pain buried in shrapnel chants.
Sunday whispers of ceasefire, yet life bleeds red.
Tents in Rafah, screams painted in wind,
ten lives extinguished in the frame of an airstrike.
Underneath, the heartbeat of Palestine; resilience unyielding,
blossoming amid the ruins, insisting existence.
